text: The Wright Cadet was a single-decker body of a midibus. It had a low floor. It was made from 2000 to 2008 Wrightbus. The Wright Cadet body was built on the DAF/VDL SB120 chassis. == Operators == From 2000 to 2008, Arriva UK ordered 366 Wright Cadets. From 2000 to 2008, Arriva Netherlands ordered 8 Wright Cadets. From 2000 to 2008, Bus Ã‰ireann ordered 35 Wright Cadets. From 2000 to 2001, UniversityBus of Hatfield ordered 5 Wright Cadets. ==Volvo Merit== From 2002 to 2008, Volvo Buses made a single-decker body of a midibus called the Volvo Merit. It had a low floor. The Wright Merit body was built on the DAF/VDL SB120 chassis. It was made because Volvo Buses stopping making its own B6BLE chassis and didn't have a replacement chassis and bodywork. Volvo removed the Wright and DAF/VDL badges. The Merits looked the same as the Cadets. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Low-floor buses Category:Midibuses Cadet
title: Wright Cadet
